snippet: Students get more fruits and vegetables under new nutritional requirements for public school lunches, but many children just toss them away.
abstract: Students now get more fruits and vegetables with their school lunches under the strictures of the Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010, but many children simply throw them away; new requirements have spawned several protests from students across the country, who complain that the new lunches are tasteless and too small.
lead_paragraph: Students get more fruits and vegetables under new nutritional requirements for public school lunches, but many children just toss them away.

headline.seo: Healthier School Lunches Face Student Rejection
headline.main: No Appetite for Good-for-You School Lunches
headline.print_headline: No Appetite for Good-for-You School Lunches
